is an interesting and attractive village near Faßberg in the southern part of the

.

The village, which is situated in the county of
is a very popular tourist spot whose catchment area includes
. It is surrounded by large tracts of forest and heathland. The nearest big towns are
Historically, Müden was a typical heathland farming village and there is still something of that atmosphere in its jigsaw of cobbled lanes away from the main roads. An artificial lake, the
has been created as a recreation area, but Müden is best-known locally for its excellent "coffee and cake" cafe in a converted barn, the
Müden can be reached easily on the local road network, from
, at the end of the road in Beckedorf turn right onto the L240 to
, stay on this road until you reach Müden, approximately 20 minutes drive from Bergen.
Müden can also be reached by bus. A regular service runs from
the nearest main railway station, which is on the Hanover to Hamburg line.
Müden is a small village with one main route going through and a minor junction leading to either
, Hermannsburg or Faßberg. The entire village is an easy stroll.

value: content=A historic brick Gothic church, typical of the Lüneburg Heath, with a separate, timber-framed bell tower. Check out the 500 year old fresco in the choir.
content=North of the village is an ancient oak, known as the
("holy oak"), which is over 600 years old. It was probably used as a
, a tree under which regular court sessions were held.
content=Each year, on the second Thursday in July, the moorland sheep (
) auction takes place. The strongest young rams are presented to breeders and spectators and the best animals win prizes. The
rams can be bid for at the accompanying auction.
content=On the second Sunday in September a mill festival (
) is held at the old mill in Müden.
name=Müden Animal Park and Treetop Climbing

content=A great activity day out. Two courses of high rope climbing through the woods. Ideal for beginners, very safe and well managed. For experts, there is an alternative course. The animal park is great for young children and very interactive. Have fun!
directions=Approx. 8 km from Müden in the village of Fassberg
content=A museum commemorating the Berlin Airlift, when West Berlin was saved from the Communist blockade in 1948/49. The museum is located in Faßberg airfield, formerly Royal Air Force Fassberg.
about 2 km before Müden just NW (left) of the L240 from Hermannsburg
content=The Wietzer Berg is a low hill (102 m) with good views over the Heath and the Örtze valley to the south and a hub for numerous walks in the area. At the summit is the

, a large "glacial erratic" rock that has been turned into a monument to Hermann Löns, the well-known heath poet. There are various scenic walks from ½ hr to 4 hrs in length and you can also walk into Müden from here. There is a car park and cafe by the road at the foot of the gentle rise leading to the monument or you can park in Müden and take a longer walk from there.

There are few shops in Müden apart from the normal baker's and grocery shops, but the village does have one or two nice antique and local craft shops that are worth browsing.
Müden has several cafés and restaurants, many serving typical regional cuisine like
(moorland sheep mutton chops), asparagus with heath-grown potatoes or
, a delicious, local gateau made using buckwheat. One with a reputation across the region is the:

value: serves the most amazing cakes and its fame has spread to German television. As a result, it can get very busy in the summer months so you may need to book in advance even for a coffee! Specialities include
directions=Go into Müden from Bergen the campsite is signposted on left at far end of village.

content=A very friendly, family-run site just outside the village of Müden, about a 20 minute drive from Hohne Camp; just far enough away when you need a break but not too much of a drive. The pitches are on well-drained grass, mostly situated in the unspoilt woodland, an ideal place if you want peace and quiet, long walks or cycle rides. All pitches have power and water, clean showers and toilet facilities. A very nice bar/restaurant run by the owners, always a warm and welcoming atmosphere, in warmer weather there is a covered seating area outside the bar where you can sit with a cold beer while you watch the world go by.
The campsite is a five minute cycle ride into the village of Müden, well known for those cream cakes! Not the most modern site but well worth a visit.
directions=from Bergen take the road to Hermannsburg, follow the signs for Müden, turn R into Müden, just 25m from the main L240 road
content=A nice hotel in a small village, the area is ideal for walking or cycling. Reputedly excellent service and recommended by numerous guides. Restaurant serves regional and French specialities.
directions=From the L240 Direction Hermannsberg, turn into the town on
, you will find the hotel on this road.
content=A country hotel typical of the area; rooms are 3 star and meals are reasonable, ranging from approx €23 to 35.

Just a few of the places of interest within easy reach of Müden are listed below,

- a quiet heath village with landing stages for launching canoes and rowing boats on the Örtze.
- heath town most noted for the nearby Belsen Concentration Camp.
- a picturesque, historic town with attractive centre, town hall and old river port.
